title.rendered: OWC successfully completes the supervision & management of the onshore & overwater cable route site investigation for the East Anglia ONE offshore windfarm

content.rendered:
Offshore Wind Consultants Ltd (OWC), part of the AqualisBraemar group, has successfully completed the supervision and management of the onshore and overwater cable route site investigation for the East Anglia ONE offshore windfarm off the east coast of the UK.

This was a high profile and complex investigation using a variety of plant and equipment at locations that were widely distributed geographically throughout the cable route. The investigation was carried out over the summer onshore, overwater in the Deben estuary, and up to 14km offshore. A geophysical survey was complemented by CPTs, cable percussive and rotary boreholes. The investigation was undertaken from a jack up, via a pontoon, and from an offshore vessel.

OWC have been commended by Paul Stearns, Head of Construction at ScottishPower Renewables Offshore for the “highly professional way that [OWC] have managed the package over the last two months”. The investigation was managed by the OWC geotechnical team and was carried out without reportable incidents, with minimal deviation from the technical scope, and within a tight timeframe.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC congratulates ScottishPower Renewables and the East Anglia ONE team
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC’s involvement with ScottishPower Renewables’ East Anglia ONE project dates back to 2013, and the global consultant is still involved today as the 714 MW offshore wind farm completes the final commissioning with all her 102 Siemens Gamesa 7 MW turbines now operational. OWC started by developing the ground model…

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC appoints head of Asia Pacific region
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Following a substantial regional expansion in Asia over recent years, international offshore wind consultancy firm OWC has appointed Tom Whittle to its newly created role of Asia Pacific regional director. In 2018, OWC opened its first Asia Pacific office in Taiwan. Today, the company also has offices in South Korea…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Offshore Wind Consultants to support Iberdrola wind farm projects
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 13 February 2017 – Offshore Wind Consultants Limited, part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA, has been awarded a framework agreement by Iberdrola to provide engineering and project management services for various wind farm projects offshore East Anglia, UK. Under the agreement, Offshore Wind Consultants Limited (OWC) will provide engineering consultancy services…

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC expands offshore wind offering
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Renewables consultancy firm OWC sets up its own energy yield assessment service capability for offshore wind projects, providing an additional integrated service offering to developers.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar beefs up ports & harbours offering to tackle renewables rush
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar is set to ramp up its ports and harbours unit and combine resources and know-how with its offshore wind consultancy unit OWC, following a surge in assignments driven by renewable energy developments.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC wins ground modelling work
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: A confidential developer has contracted OWC, AqualisBraemar’s wholly-owned renewables arm, to develop a ground model for a US offshore wind project and its cable route. A specialist team of OWC’s geoscience engineers will develop the ground model. OWC will manage the project out of its office in Boston, Massachusetts, USA.…
